RSKMnomz7MrDf5rwwTmy5g.text: I've updated my rating to 5-stars; maybe it was just that I was incredibly hungry, but my blue cheese (the usual) burger was especially delicious on my latest visit. Good serving size, succulent meat, amazing sauce, fresh toppings - truly sensational.I've also tried the Elvis burger - bananas, peanut butter, bacon, and patty. It's a messy sucker but it's quite tasty. Definitely not something I'll get regularly (the bleu royal takes that accolade) but worth experimenting with for a surprise! The chilli cheese fries are also fairly good; enough for three on the side and generous toppings. The vanilla shakes are glorious, while the chocolate comes in a far second.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore

0O29JUeGsF9SXNv5ttZbdg.text: Such yummy burgers here!  This place is straight up a burger joint and does a great job at it!  The fat basterd and the bleu peppercorn burgers are two of my favs.  The onion rings hit the spot as well.

lxnPF1f7w6XuYUyXCWiUPg.text: I had a chicken burger here and the meat didn't really have much... meat... It was mostly fat and gristle which I am not a fan of.. I'm also not really a burger person, I went here with some friends so I doubt I would have gone out of my own volition. I was impressed by the amount of choices they had so you could craft your own perfect burger though.

QXa2PjeQUE6QFBkebSUf4g.text: Set in the heart of Holland Village, Fat Boys features a very good selection of pre-set burgers with the ability to build your own with a variety of buns, meats and toppings. I tried the Fat Basterd which is 2 patties with cheddar, BBQ sauce and a fried egg on a sesame seed bun. The burger was well prepared, cooked medium with lots of flavor. Make sure to ask for extra napkins as it gets quite messy. If you are a singapore eating-pro you will probably have your own, but it never hurts to ask for more.All burgers seem to come with fries, so there isn't a need to order extras unless you are really hungry.Drinks include milkshakes, sodas and beers. Stella Artois seems to be the favored beer and they have after 10pm happy hour with price reductions.Like most places in Singapore service isn't amazing, but it's good enough. Overall, there isn't much better than sitting on a nice patio eating a good burger with a cold beer.

C4DX-Gu1_W9McYCuWI5c2g.text: Love this cosy cafe that packs a punch with an awesome list of burgers! You can even build your own burger if you know what patty works with what toppings and sauces. From the traditional to the wacky, you will never get sick of the burgers here.My favourite is still The Elvis - a dessert kind of burger with the banana, peanut butter and a pork patty with bacon in between a honey oat bun. It's magic in my mouth! I'm a dessert baby afterall!Burgers aside, the side dishes - especially the spicy drumlets are mouthwatering and portioned for about 3 to 4 people if you are also having burgers. Calamari rings in a beer batter is great too - you can taste the beer.Desserts may not sound impressive here but to get your sweet fix, order their malt milkshake that you can add more stuff like nutella, marshmellows etc! Thick, silky and creamy, it's a good way to start or end the burger meal!A place to just kickback, watch the sports channel (they have a tv in the cafe) and enjoy the awesome food they have there. A great place to enjoy the all time comfort meal - burgers!

photos.caption: Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore. My own creation - chicken, swiss cheese, mushroom, nutella and peanut butter!
Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Root beer and the chocolate milkshake with nutella and marshmellow! Richness in every sip!
Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore. The Wimpy - the smaller version of The Bastard. But there is nothing wimpy about its flavor!

PH_oqKde3uR1QjEuCN37YA.text: What is this place doing in pasir panjang road and where all these people coming from during lunch hour? People come from far apparently to enjoy the burgers here. I don't disagree with them, the burger are as juicy as it gets. The concept is too build your own burger, the true 'Have it your way" burger:CHOICE OF BUN: Sesame Seed Bun,Whole Meal Bun,Honey Oat BunCHOICE OF PATTY: Beef, Lamb, Pork, Grill Chicken, SalmonADD ONS: Bacon, Chili Queso, Guacamole, Portobello Mushroom, Sauteed Shitake Mushrooms, Sundried Tomatoes, Cheddar Cheese, Swiss Cheese, Monterey Jack, Cheese, Wild Arugula, Fried Egg, Beetroot, Caramelized Onions, Onion Marmalade, Grilled Bananas, Grilled Pineapple, Pickles, JalepenoSAUCES: Fatboy's Homemade BBQ, Wasabi Mayonnaise, Honey Mustard, Caesar Dressing, Roasted Garlic Aioli, Peanut Butter, Curry Remoulade, Bleu Cheese DressingSmoked Chipotle, Mango Chutney, NutellaI always go for the Honey Oat, Salmon, fried egg, nutella burger, yummy! Ok maybe not, but i have been curious how to combine nutella on a burger but still haven't find a way to make it work.The lamb is juicy and has a lasting deep flavour and forms a perfect combination with the caramelized onions. This burger won't leave you hungry. Do take into account some waiting time though as the burgers take a while to be prepared, usually i'm at my second milkshake already when the food is served.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore

7stJwJadVdk4yIgPflBvMA.text: The best Burger I have ever eaten in Singapore. Enough said! Definitely worth to come back. Place was packed if in large groups make reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore

vejfIqKwFUvEizqvonLbNg.text: Not bad. I thought it was a little greasy. I expected more meat than grease for the price. I would try again, maybe another location. Overall the flavor was great. The service was efficient. The airconditioning and music was good.

qy3VkHqm5G2dwhK3pTQykg.text: Had lunch at this location... Great service, awesome burger, hot and crispy fries - so much fun and so many calories all at once - definitely a treat.  Order was quick, parking was easy, place was neat and clean!

E2DxT1aWerojKe1WYVYSlQ.text: Stylish restaurant decorated with lots of passion and love. Staff is so friendly and welcoming! Would definitely recommend this place. Some people might find it a bit noisy but since I don't plan to read a book there this isn't a problem ;-)Perfect place for a burger and beer !

tvm8Qf3H0Zm33m_Ke9BPHQ.text: Some of the best service we've had in Singapore! Ridiculous number of choices for your burgers - very posh. Will return!

2ge3GyuRFo-zplyWuJATvA.text: i try to avoid carbs or go with whole wheat whenever i can. keeping that in mind, it can be exceedingly difficult to find a burger the doesn't keep me reeling with regret the day after.  that said, fatboy's offers a whole wheat burger bun that makes me feel a lot less guilty when indulging. and it's also really good! i usually go with the royale with cheese ($12, essentially a cheeseburger with a beef patty, aged cheddar cheese, BBQ sauce and onion marmalade) and tell them to swap out the sesame bun for a whole wheat bun. i've also tried the wimpy with lamb ($14.50, chewy bacon, cheddar cheese, a fried egg and bbq sauce) and been very satisfied. the burgers are BIG, and come with fries so do come with a sizable appetite. they're also cooked to medium well by default, so do let them know if you want it a little more rare. they have an extensive list of combos (bacon with bananas and peanut butter!), as well as a DIY burger bar, but i've always liked mine pretty simple and never really explored. the malt shakes also look superbly indulgent.there's a happy hour (6pm onwards), where you get a HUGE glass of Hoegaarden for like $10. that glass was bigger than my head, no joke. always been there on a weekday after work, and it's usually been practically empty. not sure why, but guess it attracts more of a lunch crowd.

8ro5Zy7BsdrKEHjqZV9aow.text: Moo, bleat, oink or cluck (what sound does a fish make?) this place is a winner. Their lamb burger is excellent, and the curry remoulade goes well with the meat and bun. The classic 'Royale with cheese' beef burger is also good. Haven't ordered a custom burger so far, but there is a good selection of meat, sauce, bun and toppings  to choose from. Fries are decent too.Their weekday lunch combos for $10 are great value, and also include non-burger selections like grilled dory, pasta marinara and chicken chops.
